intro: Halogeton paronychioides, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form and small, fleshy leaves that help reduce water loss. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It is well adapted to harsh desert conditions, with deep roots and the ability to store water in its tissues. Halogeton paronychioides plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
